text: Aus der Flasche 2016-12 getrunken. Ein schön gereiftes Bockbier mit festen Malzkörper.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Melanoidyny i alkohol. I laptop zalany piwem [*]

750 ml bottle from Tavour. Nose is caramel, butter, and a hint of char. Clear dark rusty red with a medium lightly lacing beige head. Flavor is lightly sweet with a hint of bitter and a mild alcohol warmth. Not my favorite doppelbock but OK.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Pours brown, quite dark in glass, creamy tanned head. Smell of dark fruity malts, toffee, dried fruits, hints of toast, some bread. Heavy sweet, dark delicious malts, toffee, hints of chocolate, some toast, dried fruits and nuts. Quite inviting, a very nice beer
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a thick beige head. Aroma of caramel, raisins, toffee and dried fruit. Flavor was thick and creamy with dried fruit, caramel, chocolate, coffee, raisins, toffee and rum.

A solid beer, not particularly our ideal style. Pours a muddy purple with a thin tan head. Smells a bit of strawberry and dark fruits. Taste is very fruity, not carbonated, with strawberry, green apple and plums, as well as some vanilla and caramel in the finish. Had in the bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

75cl bottle @Cimmeria,Oviedo. 26-10-2015. 
"3ª cata RateBeer Asturias".
BBD: not found.
Pours dark amber with frothy light tan head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Malty spicy aromas. Alcohol noticed, sweet aftertaste.

Beerz is fun Andy taist so gud. I am to lik this beerz. Wow wow wubzy Wow wow wubzy Wow wow wubzy Wow wow wubzy Wow wow wubzy Wow wow wubzy Wow wow wubzy Wow wow wubzy Wow wow wubzy Wow wow wubzy whoa whoa whoabash

750ml bottle. Darkest brown color with a small head. Aroma is toffee, molasses, roast, sherry, bitter cocoa. Flavor is sweet, toffee and molasses, yet a bit bitter on the end. Thick, heavy, low carb. Nice flavor but a bit of a chore to drink.

Excellent doppelbock! Aroma is roasty malty toffee caramel. Flavor is like nose, more bitter than sweet, has a long bittersweet finish, great carbonation. Not something to drink fast and a good beer to share.

Bottle 0,75 L. Sensoric. Deep brown, maggoty with big, dense, light brown head. Very good head retention and lacing. The aroma starts strong - malty (molasses, caramel, syrup, grainy), dried fruits (mainly plums), toffee, some roasted tones, light boozy notes. Taste is nice and complex at first malty semi-sweet, but in contrary to semi-bitter notes - partly tannin like, partly hoppy. Full body, thick and creamy texture, average carbonation, finish is malty with touch of roasted notes, along with some bitter character. In general this beer contains all dark beer goodies is quite powerful in its maltiness, but neither boring not mild. Im not really fan of this style, but this one is definitely worth trying.

Tasted this last years summer, bottle. 
Very excellent, easy drinkable doppelbock. Alco indeed well hidden, but some warming experience. Clean and complex maltiness without any evidence of carrot like offlavors or too much dextrin. Well rounded and enjoyable. Medium to full bodied, not thick as liquid bread.

Bottle 75cl
@ Cervezorama 2.0, Madrid, Spain.
A: Dark brown.
T: Roasted malt, caramel, raisin.
750ml bottle pours out a dark brown topped with a tan head. Nose is pit fruit rich roast malts some smoke. Taste is more of the sweet malts caramel roast and some earthy notes.

0,75l bottle shared by miza @ Dungeon de Munde. Pours clear deep brown with a low off-white head. Aroma is lightly roasted malts with some alcohol. Flavor is lightly roasted malts, chocolate, alcohol and hops. Good stuff.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; dark brown pour with a bubbly tan head, aroma has malt loaf dark fruit and toffee, taste has dark toffee, dark fruits, dark sugar, some bread.

Dark brown color with brown head. Aroma has lots of dark fruits and brown sugar. Taste follows with dark fruits, coffee, cocoa and caramel. Medium body and carbonation. A really good doppelbock, one of the best of the style.

Bottle 0.75 shared with friends on Alexeys bd.
Dark color, medium head. Aroma: caramel, raisins. Taste: warming, sweet, multi-layer. Good. Medium body.

Piwo pięknie pachnące wisniowka, czerwonym winem i leśnymi owocami. W smaku sliwka wegierka, trochę nut cherry, alkohol obecny ale szlachetny, rozgrzewający i o długim finiszu. Karmel czekolada i wanillia. Troche zbyt słodkawe ale ogolnie wielka przyjemność z degustacji tego degustacyjnego piwa.
Has a really nice flavor. Has a nice silky flavor. Looked really good in the glass.

DWF; Bottle 750 ml., drunk at Melkebaren. Poured huge, dark brown with a lasting creamy lacing, lasting head. Nose is moderate to heavy, toasted malt, caramel, rasin bread, moderate spice and wood. Taste is heavy sweet and light bitter with a warming, spice, candy dried fruit, lasting finish. Body is medium to full, texture is creamy, carbonation is flat.
Hazy, brown pour with a tan head. The aroma has caramel, wood and raisin. It has a full body with sticky texture and average carbonation. The taste is sweet with a roasted, slightly boozy finish.

W aromacie karmel, ale i sporo nut quasi belgijskich, suszonych owoców, cukru kandyzowanego, tak jakby piwo było refermentowane po belgijsku. W smaku stosunkowo wytrawne, leciutko alkoholowe, szlachetne nuty karmelu i czekolady z orzechami. Mało intensywny w smaku, za to bardzo pijalny. Mimo bardzo quadowego aromatu charakter doppelbocka został zachowany. Bardzo dobre piwo!
Dunkel orange braune Farbe, mittelgroße beige schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig, Kleber, rote Früchte. Geschmack röstmalzig, rote Früchte, Karamell, alkoholisch.

Bottle. Dark brown colour. Stable head. Complex aroma, rum, mollasses, tobaco, nuts, some roasty tones. Taste is quite the same, sweet, plus a lot of alcohol in taste (decreases the drinkability), roasted bitterness towards the end. Good one.
Bottle, dark brown color with thick beige head.Aroma of malt, lot of rum, tobacco, coffee.Taste is nice sweety, caramel, vanilla, rum, nice warmy alcohol, very good
Bottle at our elite tasting. Darker brown colour. Lots of rum, raisins, caramel, toffee. Dried fruits. Light high warming alcohol. Full bodied. Definitely a sipper. Lots of residual sugar. Very good.

Bottle kindly shared by lukka19, many thanks. Very dark chestnut brown color with thick beige head. Aroma of dark malt, rum, coffee, light tobbacco. Taste, sweet dark malt, coffee, caramel, alcohol. Very good.
Bottle shared by Lukka19, thanks. Pours brown color, lightly beige head. Aroma of rum, caramel, roasted malt, sugary. Taste is sweet, rum, chocolate, coffee, caramel, boozy, some vanilla.

Aroma of wort, caramels, gingerbread. The flavor has some booze, caramel, raisin. Dry lingering finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle shared with crew. Pours a ruby reddish dark brown with a resilient beige head. Aroma is caramel, chocolate, smoky notes. Flavor is chocolate, caramel, coffee, ash and smoke. Finish is herbal, coffee, booze. Medium to full body, average carbonation.

pours unclear dark brown with a creamy beige cap, reviving and leaving nice lacing. dark rotten red fruitiness, hint of sweetness - raisins, garbagy, resin, spices, bit of butter, perfumey booze and coriander. moderate carbonation, medium body - oily; sweet nutty-woodsy-perfumer finish. nah.

Bottle 75cl. Light medium yellow brown head. Dark color, good carbonation, small bubbles. Aroma is raisins, leather, meat, berries, chocolate, coffee. The whole spectrum. A sweet brew, but hops is absolutely present. Balanced.
.75 bottle, sb. Brown dark coloured. Chocolate malty, some milk chocolate on nose. Full bodied, but smooth, lean, quite nice easy drink.-- bb

3a cata RateBeer Cimmeria Oviedo 26..10..2015. Botella 75 cl. sin lote ni Fcpref. (r353). Color oscuro muy turbio con bastante espuma beige. Aromas y sabores maltosos tostados con caramelos también tostados algo ahumados. Frutos pasos ligeramente dulces. Cuerpo medio ligero en boca fácil de beber con algo de espuma fina. Buena sensación alcohólica en aumento según va calentando. Buena.
Bottle looks really good. Beer in the glass brownish, nice head. Starts strong, malty, light alcoholic notes, not too sharp. Light nutty hints. All in all well balanced. Warming finish. Really nice!

750 mL bottle. Medium brown pour with a couple fingers of beige head after a vigorous pour. Big malty aroma, some roast, leather, little bit of smoke, caramel. Taste is similar malt affair, a bit of the alcohol comes through. Medium to full bodied, slightly fizzy carbonation.

Botella, @3º Cata Ratebeer Asturias.. 26/10/2015. 
Color marrón oscuro, aromas y sabores dulces.

How : bottle ( a big one) Appearance : light brown color with a medium to small tanned head. Aroma : dried fruits, plums, candied orange peel, herbs, dark caramel, muscovado sugar, brandy. Palate : almost full body, soft carbonation.
Bottle, sample @ RBScSG 15. Brownish pour with tiny lacings. Nose is malty, caramel and vanilla. Taste is sweet, syrupy, caramel and sweet malts.
Strong malty aroma with burnt sugar and molasses. Dark woody color with a thin head. Big flavors of molasses, syrup, alcohol and rich malt. Really good thick palate.

75cl bottle from cerveteca lisboa, portugal. Color is dark brown, red. Large brown head. Medium body. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter. Aroma is chocolate, malt, vanilla, bourbon. Flavour is alcohol, malt, wood, fruity, caramel.

Bottle at Grand Tasting, RBSCSG 2015 cons 2015-07-11 Göteborg
AR: roasted malt, bready syrup, chocolate, coffey
AP: brown and thick, beige head
F: sweet syrup, warmnig feeling, sugar cake, pruns,

Bottle. Pours brown with big yellowish fluffy-thick head.Aroma is sweet, malty. caramel, dark berries, toffee. Taste is a lot of coffee beans, caramel, toffee, raisins, malty, some wine notes, oak. Medium to heavy body. Sweet finish.

Chestnut colour liquid with beige head. Aroma: caramel, bread, chocolate. Taste: heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, coffee, rum. Palate: full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,
Sample at RBScSG. Hazy dark golden copper with off white head. Malty with roasted tones, dried fruit and more malt. Dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation.

Draft. Nose is sugary diabetes with some light bready notes with caramel. Dark brown pour with a small off white head. Taste is thick, rich, luscious, sugar. Lots of sugar. A weird antigencu with bitterness that doesnt seem hop related. Like grainy tannin astringency. Some raisin and prune flavors come through as it warms along with the alcohol. Overall ok but a few retractions prevent this from being awesome.

Sampled at RBScSG -15
Dark brown with at an head. 
Malty aroma with notes of vegetables. 
Sweet flavour with salty soy and liquorice. 
Medium bitterness.

Amazing brew. Pours a completely opaque black with a thick, foamy beige head. Creamy and thick the head sticks around forever. The aroma is typical of doppelbocks with heavy grainy malts, toasted notes, burnt toast, light cocoa bean. Rich and heavy first sip with a crazy complexity and heavy alcohol presence. Vanilla bean, a bit of licorice root, espresso, cocoa. Nice and heavy like a Baltic porter.Full body with a slightly creamy mouthfeel. Holy crap what a good brew.

Sötét, rubinos árnyalatokat megcsillantó testtel tűnik elő a duplabakként megjelölt Mikkeller specialitás, ujjnyi vastag, bézs színű habot produkálva. Kissé meglepő módon leginkább fekete ipák tapasztalása során felbukkanó sötét hangulatú, egyszerre pirított és komlós világú, növényes aromájú, ázott szegfűszáras jegyeket megcsillantó illatok kerülnek előtérbe, melyek mellett egy kevés karamell és csokoládéba burkolt maláta is leteszi vaskos kontúrral meghúzott névjegyét. Közepes testét éjfekete csokoládé, ízlésesen pörkölt maláta, nem utolsó sorban pedig karcos komló szerkezete feszíti meg, mely utóbbi elem számomra legalábbis igencsak főszereplője az előadásnak. Korántsem állítom, hogy stílusidegen jegyek uralmától terhes főzettel van dolgunk, mindenesetre egy, a szokásosnál talán komló-központúbb alkotásról beszélhetünk, már amennyiben utunkat a duplabakok specifikus komponensei által kitaposott ösvényen kívánjuk bejárni. A dán Megváltó ez esetben és ebben az értelemben tehát nem feltétlenül mutat rokonságot német megfelelőjével, s bár összességében egy remek italról van szó, ha a kategória keretein belül szemlélődve járunk el, nem biztos, hogy otthonosan érezzük majd magunkat. Ettől elvonatkoztatva azonban feltétlenül megéri elmerülni a kakaós, pirított magvas, karamellás és szigorú arculatú komlós egyvelegben, mely önmagában véve egy szertelenül hibátlan remekmű.
Aroma of cocoa, malt & coffee. Black with large brown head. The taste is dry with coffee & smoke. Medium body & average carbonation.

750ml bottle (thanks FatPhil). Clear copper colour. Small size, yellow head, stays. Malty, caramel, sweet, raisins, faint mint in aroma. Roast, malty, grainy, raisins, dusty in taste. Medium bitterness. Roasted caramel and dusty malts in taste. Hop bitterness is gone wrong in here. Alcohol is well covered. Soft carbonation.

750ml bottle (Drink Shop, Tallinn)
Sweet raisiny aroma, bran and other rabbitfood. Some heavy esters, but a little alcohol too, even through the sugars. Stodgy, a little marmitey in its yeastiness. Heavy and sticky, but not boozy per se. Strange rubberiness in the taste. Odd burntness in the finish, a bit dirty, and a little bit yeasty. Even more booze comes over in the aroma later, but not offensively so, as the sugars cover it. A bit of a weird one, no reason for a beer like this to exist when the Germans do decent strong bocks.

Bottled 750ml. -from Svijet Piva Zagreb. Dark brown coloured with red glare, medium to big sized brown head, pleasant caramel and alcohol nose. Sweet malty, caramel, dried fruits and alcohol with notes of hops and licorice. Mild touch of chocolate in rather alcoholic finish. To be honest theres nothing special here but I have to admit its tasty brew.

Bottle. Pours a clear, dark ruby red amber with a big, frothy, off white head. Aroma has lots of sweet chocolate, caramel malts and in general just huge amounts of malt. Figs, jam, strawberry and tobacco. Taste is sweet, malty chocolate with a slight hoppy end. Caramel sweetness, but still a pleasant beer to drink, also because the alcohol is hidden really well. Medium carbonation.

0,75L bottle (from Koht). Pours very dark ruby-black with light brown head. The head stays. Aroma is sweet, malt, and some alcohol. Flavor is sweet, dark chocolate, malt, yeast. Overall: very nice one.

Brown beer, medium beige head. Nose is malts, caramel, hops, sweet hints. Flavor is dark fruit, malts, caramel, dark chocolate, licorice. Hops, licorice and caramel in the finish. Pretty smooth stuff, very drinkable for the ABV. Nice balance. Shared by martjoobolut, thanks!

Quite intense maltiness, light roasted note, caramel, decent hops, intense fruitiness, berries, nuts, dried fruits, bit warming. Moderate to intense sweetness, moderate bitterness with bittersweet finish. Great brew!

Brownish red color. Thick, creamy beige head. Aroma of malt and red berries. Cherry, raspberry and blackcurrant. Full body. Taste of berries. Very sour! I dont like it. First beer rated that I didnt finish.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Tasted on Christmas Eve 2014. Dark brown beer with a nice offwhite/beige head. Roasted bready aroma, caramel, grassy, biscuits, some chocolate. Roasted bready flavor, chocolate, cocoa, fruity notes, smoked, warming alcohol. Sweetish bready and boozy finish.

På flaska från SB. Etiketten anger Trippelbock, men, men. Dofter av brödig kaka och syrliga röda bär. Smak inleds med syrliga bär, sedan framträder toner av en maffig fruktkaka. Avslutningen är sötsur. Ölvärldens egensinnigaste dansk har gjort ytterligare en tolkning med egen twist.

Bottle. Pours intense clear ruby red with light brown frothy head. Aroma is really chocolatey. Loads of dark dried fruits, figs, strawberry jam, some mint and bridge mix. Light earthy hops, bread crust, light booze. Tobacco? Taste chocolate malts, really toasty, sweet light burnt caramel, figs in alcohol, turns dry toasty with slight hoppy finis, the earthy hops, full body and really hidden abv, only subtle on the back of the tongue! Nice take on a bock.

Bottle. 

Pours really dark amber, with a light foam.

Aroma is chocolate, vanilla and mint.

Taste is lots and lots og chocomint. Like liquid after eight! 
Slightly roasted, caramel malt. 
Really nice!

0,375 l bottle via Mikkeller Julepakkekalender Bottled as Trippelbock 
Aroma is raspberry, chocolate, brown, hazy, frothy, tan foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, medium sourness, medium body, oily feel, fizzy, long finish,

Dark dark brown with a huge off white and lively head. Aroma is dominated by dried fruits, sweet notes, leather. Big bodied and flavourful, fruity notes with light yeast notes with some hint of chocolate. Complex and awesome
75 cl bottle @ home. Pours dark brown with an off-white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma and flavour are caramel, nuts, roasted malt, and hops - with a bitter finish.

Caramel, dark roasted malts, and hints of coffee fill the nose. While a solid brown pour with a handsome espresso head produces normal lacing. The taste is robust, malt forward and somewhat bitter. Richly roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, dark fruit, caramel, and a smokey peat note. Medium body and medium carbonation. Bitterish dry finish. Slight suggestions alcohol in the finish. Overall, this is a complex brew that improves as it warms.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a glass. Black with fluffy light brown head. Aroma is dark fruit, medium body, medium/well carbonated, and little lacing. Taste is roasted malt, smoke, dark fruit, and hints of alcohol. This is as much as a strong dark belgian ale as a doppelbock.  Hell this could easily save two people.
"called a doppel and a triple bock. not like any doppel ive had. less bready, more extreme caramel, brown sugar, alcohol, sweet fruity. pretty good, but also pretty in your face."
Pours dark and mysterious. Very complex, with dark fruit, chocolate, leather and spices. Sweet but not cloying.

Bottle at home. BB 10.1.2014. The colour is deep reddish brown and with a big, creamy, beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, leather, coffee, dried fruit, rye bread, some alcohol and a good dose of hops. Complex. Fruity flavour with much hops at first, and then goes into a chocolate middle stage before ending quite roasted. Alcohol warmth in the background. Has a rich and slick mouth feel, and a medium bitterness. An incredible complex and compact doppelbock. Is rich with a lot of hops still very present after over 2 years of aging.

(750mL bottle from LCBO, cellared ~2.5 years) Pours a clear dark brown with a moderate pillowy tan head, loads of lace. Aroma of raisin and prune, toffee malts, leather, tobacco, light smoke/chocolate, scotch (peat?), perhaps something herbal. Very complex nose at any rate. On the palate, rich chocolatey malt and cherry-type fruit at first, caramel, somewhat sweet. Drier in the middle with more leather/wood/herbal character creeping in. Towards the finish, quite dry, coffee grounds, wood, tobacco, smoke and ash, feels like a whack of bittering hops lend medicinal, menthol character. Some sweetness to the aftertaste but detectable alcohol and those hops leave it dry and tingly on the tongue, a nice surprise. Full, rich body with moderate carb. This is a weighty beer, but it is a lot drier and more drinkable than I expected from the style. Very complex too. Glad to be sharing such a big bottle with my girlfriend, but each sip showcases new layers too.

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours dark brown with a small, beige head. Aroma of roasted and toffee and caramel malts, some dough, hints of alcohol, and notes of dark fruits. Flavor the same. Average texture. A decent beer.
Deep brown with low medium carbonation. Malty nose with some spice and peaty smoke. Sweet start with spicy yeast esters, maybe very light banana, light smoke, lightly dry finish.
Dark brown, thick biege head. Coffee aroma. Deep coffee and slight chocolate taste. Smokey. absolutely delicious. Love it.
Glowing thick dark brown. leather prune smells. Big teriyaki, soy sauce thick syrup taste. A light sweet roasted taste in there as well. Lots of flavor to explore in this one.
Advertised as a Triple Bock at RnH, 2010. Sweet chocolatey, a touch boozy, has a nice fruitiness in the midpalate that melds nicely with the chocolate bitterness. Very nice.

750 ml bottle - pours deep brown, with a small soapy off-white yellowish head. Immediately an aroma of rhum soaked raisins and salted caramel. Medium body, high on the sour side, alcohol sting as from the middle darkly roasted and slightly smoked towards the end. Peat aromas and light toffee taste. and alcohol burn - pity

Pour from bottle - milk chocolate brown with creamy tall head
Aroma - Very fruity aroma. Raisins, figs, dates, dark cherries, raspberry. Also loads of chocolate, brown bread, and faint whiff of booze. 
Taste - chocolate covered cherries, raisins, bubblegum, roasted malt, citrus hops, touch of lemon juice. 
Palate - oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation, syrupy heavy body, sweet aftertaste that is pretty brief. 

Very delicious, but pretty sweet and heavy. Definitely share a bottle with a friend.

Bottle, shared with edvard january 25th 2014. Dark brown body, big beige head. Aroma of malt, raisin, herbs and alcohol. Taste is spicy, choriander and chamomilla, with raisins, licorice and malt. Slightly alcoholic finish, with a herbal and malty aftertaste. Very heavy without being too sweet.
Very thick and malty. Long-lasting head. Slight coffee, but predominately chocolate flavor. Its almost like eating a Snickers bar. This one drinks slowly.

Bottle (75cl). Inch-thick light beige head, good retention, settles as a thick bubbly layer with flame-shaped lacing. Dark brown colour. Complex, sweet malty aroma with raisins/prunes, chocolate, licorice, menthol, wood, ash, vanilla, whisky. Full body, yet somewhat lighter than expected from the ABV. Soft carbonation. Taste is dryer than suggested by the nose, very well balanced with a rich bitter-sweet and woody maltiness. The finish is tongue-dryingly bitter with sweet malt and menthol/cloves.

January 2, 2014. 750mL bottle from LCBO quite some time ago, pulled from our cellar. Lovely caramel and raisin aroma. Opaque. Lovely lacing. Thinner than expected. Would not guess this is 11%, masks the alcohol quite well. Bit of lingering bitterness on the end. Wish we could get more Mikkeller in Ontario.
shared 75cl bottle. doesnt appear like a bock beer. dark brown with a nutty brown head. sweet sugar, dark fruits, raisins, malts, plums, chocolate. the alcohol in this beer is incredibly well hidden

Bottle. Pours creamy brown with tall tan head. Aroma is caramel, molasses. Taste incorporates those flavors with bread, cocoa. Thin and oily. Not as heavy as expected which was a nice surprise. Alcohol hidden well. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
By far the most aromatic and flavorful new beer of the hunting trip. Thick with some strong toffee and a bit of molasses. Rally good just a tad sweet for me.

750ml bottle shared at home, BBE Jan 2014, so thought Id better crack it open! Very dark brown pour with a big creamy head, fades slowly but a little hangs around. Aromas of tamarind, prunes, fruit preserved in alcohol, smoke, juniper, chocolate, dark, dark sugar. the list goes on. Some wood notes as it warms up. Taste has all this and more. A rounded sweetness with an orange bitterness. Some liquorice popping up. I could sip this all night (although I probably wont). A great beer.

750 ml bottle to snifter (shred by me with the crew). Looks good; a semi-cloudy brown with foamy light beige head. Smells solid; sweet and malty. Tastes like it smells with a nice, smooth mouthfeel. This is good beer.

Seems there is something for everyone thrown into this brew. A bit of a weird combination between a lot of ingredients. Sour, bitter and sweet gets blenden together, but they wont totally fix in this one. Coffee, chocolate, some dark fruits and spices in top. To many different stuff going on to be a good brew for me.
Big boozy but not in rum? Nice touch. A little sweet for the style but legendary. Obviously. Malt, funk, chocolate, raisins and more raisins. Booze booze but a great after taste.

Brune. Alcool. Chaleur dalcool. Caramel. crème brûlé. Fruité. Framboise. Sirop dérable. Grain grillé. Banane. Bonbon. Menthe. Très amère. Sèche en finale. Toffee. Tire ste-catherine. Exceptionnellement délicieux.

Bottle shared by Doug at Mikeys summer bash 
Hazy brown with a small beige head and some lacing. Aroma of malts, leather and dark fruity. Flavors of roast malts, dark fruit, leather and toffee 
Nice and tasty

750 ml bottle. Pours a dark murky brown color with a small beige head. A huge dark fruity roast and yeasty nose. The flavor is warmth, dark pitted fruits, some smoke, caramel, a shot of liquor slips in. Pretty intense and still drinkable.

750 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a big creamy head that fades quickly but never completely goes away, leaves some nice webbing. Malty and fruity aroma, toffee, caramel, slightly sour fruit, light chocolate, molasses, and some other spices or hops. Taste is a bit odd. Very strong sweetness is a bit cloying. The toffee and caramel malt taste is good but the finish of bitter chocolate and sour fruit is weird. I think theres some of spices here but I dont know what they are, I dont like em. This reminds me of an English barley wine with no hops to balance the sweetness and booziness. Alcohol is fairly noticeable in the finish too. Thick body, creamy mouthfeel. Overall, really nice aroma but Im not a fan of the taste or the finish. Just not my kinda beer but I could see some people loving this one.

Some more backlog. On tap @ BBF 2009. Black color. No head. Aromas: flowery hops, with malty sweetness, some sour fruit and alcohol retronasal. Flavor is medium sweet, roasted malts, some acidity and bitterness. Pretty strong alcohol feel and full bodied. Bitter finish. Worth the try.

Bottle.
Very dark brown, fluffy beige head.
Rich nose, malt and chocolate. Packed with flavour, alcohol warming, sugar and bitterness that (almost) balances it all. It calls for slow sipping.

750ml. bottle that Quevillon graciously shared with me.The color is a dark brown with a dark beige head and nice lace.The aroma is of roasted malt,caramel.The taste also of roasted malt plus bitter fruits, a very dry taste.The 11 % alcohol is not that noticeable in the aroma but a bit more in the taste that last a long time.
Bottle. The look is brownish in color with red tinges with a beige colored head. The smell is sweet, malts, fruits, and alcohol. The taste is malts, alcohol, sweet, and fruits.

From bottle, aged at least a year. Deep mahogany colour like a stout but lacking the smooth head. Lovely head nonetheless. Wonderful rich fruity aroma. Bourbon soaked raisins, some chocolate, red wine, grapes, butter. Flavor is big and boozy, warm and lingering. Thick malts with a smooth well balanced bitterness. Rumtopf anyone? Chocolate covered raisins. Lots of fun to drink, plenty going on. Smooth mouthfeel and delightful lingering notes without a sticky palate.

love the bottle design, brown in colour, brown sugar aromas , tastes brown .. just joking, tastes of coffee and sweet malt. sweet aftertaste/linger but the bitters of the coffee were much better than sleep over.

750ml bottle: pours a barely transparent dark mahogany with a small creamy froth of light tan head. Has a sweet toasted dark caramel malty nose with some dark fruits and a touch of doughy yeast. Starts with pretty goodfullness and light carbonation with sweet dark malts, some light oxidation and toffee with some plums and bready yeast. Finishes sweet and slightly warming. Pretty true to style and complex.

Wow, that is excellent. Dark coffee and brown sugar. Brandy soaked figs and dates with a nice raisin sweetness. Bitter chocolate burnt toast. There is a alcohol finish but it isnt off putting it actually helps and enhances.

Bottle at JFs, BOE, 07/03/13. 
Hazed dark chestnut brown with a thin beige head that dissipates to the edge and leaves a film.
Nose is dark malt, dark toffee, brown sugars, booze, some background hops.
Taste comprises dark toffee, light chocolate, hint of orange, booze, some hops.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, sweet boozey finish.
Great stuff, hoppy backnotes, boozey but well disguised for 11% !
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 750 mL bottle from the LCBO, served in a stem glass. Pours deep chestnut with a moderate, dense tan head. The head mostly remains and leaves a moderate amount of loose lace. On the nose, there are notes of brown sugar, molasses, dark fruit and dark chocolate, along with herbal hops, and a hint of ginger spice. The flavour begins moderately sweet with molasses and brown sugar, nutty malts and a hint of chocolate. Espresso and spicy ginger enter in the middle along as the hops pick up. It becomes spicier towards the finish, which is also somewhat bitter. On the palate, it is full in body with a smooth, creamy texture and average carbonation. Overall, this is a huge doppelbock with a spicy, herby quality and a big boozy presence. It grew on me as it warmed, and its complexity started to come through. A nice brew that will be interesting to try after some ageing. 2012-07-05

Tasted blind. Deep brown with a light tan head. Nose is caramel sweet malt, butterscotch, and justmaltiness. Taste has a bit of smokiness to itsweet and caramelly with the smoke, medium roast, and a bit of booze. Thinnish body with a decent amount of carbonation.

A - Dark brown with a finger of frothy tan-khaki head. Fades normal.

S - Sweet caramel and dark caramel malts, dark fruits, cherry, chocolate, caramelized sugars, a bit of molasses and smoke, and a bit of booze.

T - Sweet caramel and dark caramel malts, cherry, raisins, and other dark fruits, chocolate, caramelized sugars, molasses, smoke, lager yeast, some booze.

M - Full bodied, moderate carbonation. Smooth with a warming, sweet finish.

D - Nicely balanced doppelbock. Great malty complexity.

70 cl. bottle @ home. Pours a dark brown colour with beige 1 finger head. The aroma is malty, notes of chocolate, caramel and coffee-like. some berries (like cherries in madeira) the taste is full bodied with malty flavours. some ripe fruits, some hoppiness and a slight hint of alcohol. Not a "trippelbock", but still a decent beer.

Dark brown colour, beige head. Aroma of caramel, molasses, roasted malts and some coffee. Quite sweet flavour, bitter roasted malts, cacao. Quite full. Sweet finish, roasted malts bitter.
(From 75cL bottle @ RBBWG II, Wilrijk 2013. Courtesy of sebletitje. Thanks for sharing Seba!)

Thanks to cfrancis. Pours a dark brown with a sizeable cream/tan coloured head leaving great lace up the glass. Aromas of citrus, grass, dark fruits, some roasted malts. Flavours are citrus, medium bitterness, dark fruits, roasted malts. Im rating this out of style, more so as a mikkeller which doesnt always fall under specific styles...

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2013 Thanks to cfrancis for this. Pours a cloudy brown with a reddish hue. Aromas are huge citrus, grassy hop aromas with some dried dark fruits and roasted malt aroma.  Taste is citrus hops, dark fruit, roasted malts, chocolate and a smooth bitterness on the finish.  Very smooth for an 11% beer and has a creamy mouth-feel.  Could drink a couple pints of this beer in one night.

75cl bottle sample @ RBBWG 2013.
Cuivrée, col beige.
Bière type Mikkeller tentant de restituer un style allemand avec ici encore une version dont lalcool est revisité à la hausse. Le tout garde un profile caramel, malté avec une pointe de houblon en amertume et dépices. Chocolat léger et grillé pour le malt. Les 11% restent discrets.
Sampled from bottle @ RBBWG 2013. Dark red color, small off-white head. Smell and taste malts, roastyness, some coffee, moccha and some alcohol.  Full body with a medium to full carbonation.

Bottle. Dark brown/ruby pour with tan head. Massive aroma, dried fruits,  milk chocolate, prune, apricot. Tasye is incredibly rich caramel, prune, apricot with chocolate. A bit bitter on the finish which I wasnt expecting. Really loved this beer.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours dark brown with low beige head. Aroma is of malt, bready. Taste is of malt, bread, some spices. Overall: Good, not outstanding.

Bottle (750 ml). Shared by Minderbinder at a RBQ tasting. Hazy amber with a medium off-white head and good lacing. Aroma and taste of malt, caramel, toffee, raisins, spices and slight mineral notes. Taste isnt too sweet. Medium body. Alcohol is present. Average/good beer. I was expecting this one to be a little more rich.

Dark brown pour with three fingers of frothy tan head. Very strong caramel malt aroma, the alcohol is quite noticeable. Sweet and rich malt flavor, the alcohol is a little less noticeable on the tongue. Sticky and full bodied, it is a very good dopplebock.

Draft at Dutchs (late 2011?).  Pours dark brown color with a medium sized diminishing khaki head.  The aroma has dark chocolate and caramel, roasted malts, dark fruits favoring plums and raisins, and a mild herbal note.  The flavor opens with dark fruit, roasted malts, sticky sweetness, and caramel.  Toward the finish, there is more chocolate and more dry herbal notes.  The alcohol is not hidden, but not a terrible distraction either. Medium to full bodied.
Brown colour. Fruity caramel smell. Taste is caramel fruitiness, toffee, with a hint of sourness.

November 1, 2012, 11% abv, 750 mL bottle, tumbler, BTL: 12/04/12 Aroma of dark fruit, sweet malts and a touch of traditional dried herbs. 
Pours a dark chocolate brown with a white frothy head. (rest of notes illegible)  Complex mixture of amazing taste sensation! Chocolate is most evident and replaced by toffee and sweet bready malts. After the sweets comes the alcohol booze and spice. A nice carbonation cuts through viscous/oily texture and booze a bit, which is nice. Sort of wish it wasnt so alcohol heavy. Powerful.

Big brown wine bottle found at the LCBO. Pours a cola colour with red highlights. The beige head is huge, has great retention and creates good thick lace. Loads of dark fruits in the aromas with anise and other grassy plants. Mild warming oily mouthfeel, but quite surprised how no burning is felt. The roasted malts are overpowered by licorice and the hop makes a greater appearance, creating some nice bitterness in the finish. This Trippelbock has great drinkability for 11% ABV and is well-worth trying.

May 4, 2012 - with blankboy, garthicus, gregclow, jercraigs & mabel.  My 750ml bottle from the LCBO.  Deep ruby-brown with a huge lasting frothy/foamy straw-coloured head.  Aromas of alcohol, sour lactic something, sharp and herbal.  Taste is pretty boozy, initially very metallic, settles to nutty malt, alcohol and various health food store herbal notes - the metal never completely fades, otherwise this would be 8/10 instead of 7-.  Light bodied, slick, mildly carbonated, a little harshness builds in the finish, which is otherwise somewhat herbal/bitter (and metallic/minerally too).

Bottled. Pours a clear, amber with a medium sized, beige head, leaving a good lacing. Nose of fruit, caramel, chocolate and nuts. Sweet flavor with a more dry finish along with some alcohol and slightly bitter. Medium to full bodied, oily texure and soft CO2. Nice indeed.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma of caramel, malt, wet grass and raisins. Flavor is sweet and malty with roasted notes, coffee, warming alcohol and some berries. Medium body, average carbonation.

Huge beige head.  Deep dark red body.  Deep fruity caramelly
chocolate aroma with alcoholic toffee and spice notes.  Dry-sweet
herbal spicy caramelly taste with cumin notes.  Full-bodied.
Sharpish, slightly hot mouthfeel, growing hotter at the end.  Dry
chocolatey spicy aftertaste with herbal minty cloves notes.
Interesting, unusual, and scarily drinkable.  (0.75l bottle, wine
monopoly, Vika, Oslo.)

Bottle, 75 cl. Pours dark brown with creamy light brown head. Nose has: roasted malts, chocolate, figs, caramel, molasses, alcohol and lots of spice. Taste is much the same with raisins, a lot of roastiness, bitter chocolate, hops and fruits and alcohol. It has a full body, little carbonation and is oily thick. The finish is fantastic and presents the tastes in different variations and strengths according to each sip. Carries the alcohol very nicely, but be careful, you might drink it all.

750 ml bottle

An expensive price tag knocks this down a few pegs from an excellent beer to middle of the pack. While I understand the markup (small brewery, distance of distribution, and so on) it just comes across as a little underwhelming. That wont stop me from buying the occasional Mikkeller but I wont be buying them frequently.

Aroma / Appearance - A rich chocolately base looks like a bottle of watered down syrup. Long inky legs betray the ABV. Chocolate in the nose is fine but this suffers the fate of many huge doppelbocks - that tinge of soy. Less alcohol might have brought this down a notch.

Flavor / Palate - Chocolate, malt balls, and that distracting soy flavor alternate between good and bad. The thick texture of the mouthfeel requires some patience. For the ABV it does not overwhelm as much as some other Mikkeller beers. Even so it is an average doppelbock at best.

pours dark with moderate beige head.  It is amazing that this beer is 11%.  There is no alcohol burn whatsoever.  It is extremely smooth and easy drinking.  Pair that with a nice nose and nice flavour (malty chocolate and slight hint of dark fruit)...a quality brew.  Having said that there was no "wow" factor aside from the drinkability for abv.  would buy again but wouldnt seek it out

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2012 Re-rating thanks to onkelgobber. Serious bitter orange the whole way through. The balance is great and its due a bit of an increase in score.    

Previous rating 31/08/12 = 8+4+8+4+16=4.0  
75cl bottle thanks to allmyvinyl. Pours opaque black with a nice crema head. The nose has incredibly rich fruit cake and toffee. The taste is equally intense and there is a real sticky toffee pudding thing going on but the main note is actually prunes in alcohol. The palate is huge in body, the texture is like crude oil and the finish despite all of this isnt as cloying as I expected. Overall, a tasty big beast of a beer.

750 ml bottle purchased at the LCBO in Rideau and King Edward (Ottawa) on May 13, 2012. Dark brown cola, little head. Aroma of barley sugar, chocolate and licorice, malted well. Taste of cocoa, ripe and sour red fruits, dry and bitter, aftertaste of alcohol. Powerful beer in all senses, even too much!

Mmmmm... super nice beer. Smells like chocolate covered raisins, only the chocolate is dark. Pours with good head, great lacing. Dark brown. Taste is a little boozy but nothing considering the high alcohol percentage. Taste has a little sweetness and a good dose of dark chocolate-style bitter. All kinds of good in all kinds of ways. Too bad its so pricey in the lcbo, at least the taste somewhat justifies it. 750ml bottle.

Pours coffee brown with red highlights and dark tan head. Aroma is nutty, sweet, liquorice hints, a tad metallic. Flavor is complex: candied nuts and peel, coffee, liquorice, maple syrup and roasted malt. Some alcohol burn, delicious.

750ml bottle, shared with Alicia. The label is pretty awesome. I didnt notice the white feet at all until she pointed it out, up until then all I saw were black figures. Nice tan head, that persists. Some lacing. Wow, amazing for 11%.. Very smooth and easy to drink. Very nice roasty flavor. Some chocolate. Caramel malts. Little dark fruit, plums... "deep" fruit. Little spice. Light bitter taste. Astoundingly little bite, so smooth for 11%. I was expecting something liquory, but this is way better than I expected. Awesome imperial doppelbock.

Deep ruby/brown in colour with a long lasting good sized tan head, excellent lacing.  The aroma is of gingerbread, lots of malt, caramel, dark fruits.  The flavour is sweet, malty, lots of gingerbread, roasty, light alcohol.  Sweet and warming mouthfeel, medium body, moderate carbonation.  Finishes long, sweet and malty, warming.

Its nice.  I like this better then Salvator and Celebrator.

750ml bottle from Premier Gourment in Buffalo, New York.
Opened on December 3, 2011.
No date.

Bottle.  Black with a beige foam.  Aromas are toffee and caramel with rye bread and raisins.  Lightly smoky with roast malts and plummy fruit.  Peppery with almond nuttiness and red wine notes.  Flavours are raisins and bittersweet grapefruit with floral notes.  Earthy, salty soy with dark chocolate and vinous fruit.  Sweet, fruity with chocolate milkshake and grapefruit bitterness to finish.  Very good.

It pours black with auburn highlights; the head is beige and mousy. The aroma has notes of: leather, dark chocolate, espresso, alcohol, and pumpernickel bread. The taste is heavy sweet that finishes sweet; there are notes of: molasses, chocolate, rum, raisins, and pumpernickel. The body is heavy-light, the carbonation is low, and the finish is long. Overall, youd think that the body be bigger  oh well, still delicious.

Draught @ Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, Denmark
Pours deep ruby brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, toffee and dried fruits. Taste is heavy sweet and light to medium bitter with a long malty sweet and light bitter finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

[4418-20120504] 750mL bottle. Chocolate-covered strawberry fruity malt aroma. Clear, red-hued mahogany body with a medium-lasting creamy tan head. Bitter chocolate-fruity malt flavour has a super boozy base. Full body has a lot of bitterness. Tasty but quite bold and boozy. (7/4/7/4/15) 3.7
Overheard: "I accidentally wound up with some and deleted it immediately."
(c/o HogTownHarry, w/ him, blankboy, garthicus, GregClow, jerc)

Bottle [750ml] shared with HogTownHarry, garthicus, GregClow, jerc & mabel -- c/o HogTownHarry. Pours a deep ruby-brown with an average size diminishing frothy tan head. Aroma is very fruity along with brown sugar, caramel malt and light hops. Flavour of yeast, caramel malt, light hops, light alcohol and a big bitter finish. Medium bodied, almost creamy mouthfeel. Very good, I enjoyed it.

From the bottle, pours a lovely deep brown to black with a tan head.  Lots of great malt character to this one, caramel, chocolate, molasses, roasted nuts.  A bittersweet flavour profile with a touch of black licorice and raisin.  Fantastic beer, especially for those cold Autumn days.

Awesome beer! Pours brown with a long lasting head covering and massive lacing. Nose is molasses, some espresso and maybe a hint of ginger. Mouth up front is sweet molasses with a roasted backing and lingering bitterness. Creamy in the mouth with medium carbonation. A real pleasure.
Nice robust head, very dark -brown body. It tastes roasty-alcoholic, flowery, nice! Then it is also a bit creamy-sweet. Very nice and intensiv!
Molt complexa aromàticament: figues, caramel, cafè... Cremosa i llarga. Molta regalèsia en boca. Gran, molt gran.
Wow!  What a beer.  Aroma of brown sugar, glazed figs, and heaven.  Pours bock brown with great lacing.  Great viscosity.  Taste is rich with sugar, fig and slight rhubarb.  Amazing beer.

Tap at Sail & Anchor. Very big beer this one. Dark brown, almost opaque pour with a small off white head. Nose is very sugary - brown sugar, and sweet with hints of pepper and caramel. Loads of fig and dates with light caramel and pepper tones to finish on. Brown sugar is quite forward but the sweetness works well in the drinkability of this beer. 11% abv is hidden well. Nice brew for sure

Bottle 750  ml 
Aroma:   nice, brown sugars ,malts with solid does of fresh hop feel. Caramel on sides. 7+
Appearance: cola  brown with light brownish top .
Body , Flavour , Palate and Final Notes:  full bodied with thinner walls. Brown sugars, fig, caramel with , mineral and grassy accents. Dryness of alcohol sitting at back end. Solid depth. Chewy mid feel. Bitter backing. This is big hefty brew that is best shared with friends.

Aroma is dark caramelly mixed with a rye-bready distinctness, which is hugely complex; ends up with somwhat of a roasty after"smell" in your nose. The body is what youd expect from such a strong bock, yet very drinkable; which would make it somewhat of a tweener considering the strength. Its by no means sticky as some bocks tend to be and therefore I find it superior to.... actually..... 80% of all beers Ive tried, which fall into that category. I like!

On tap at Mikkeller Bar.

Dark brown with a with a small rather creamy head. Aroma of spices, malt, sweet licorice and some notes  of tobacco. This was a heavy and rather good beer. The finish was long.

Lite stickande doft. Het smak och söt av lakrits och tobak. Eftersmaken är mycket het och trevlig. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle Pours a dark brown clouded lager in the stein with a 3 finger frothy cap that lasts well and laces the glass.  Soft carbonation. Aroma is slightly understated when chilled  dark cocoa, sweet bready malts, some noble earthiness light whiff of fusel alcohol.
Big rich chewy malts in front  chocolate, nutty bready with some figs and treacle all balanced well with some really resinous hopping = goes to a long roasty bitter finish with a metallic hop aftertaste. Wow a big beer. But is it a dark (dunkler) triple bock or just a hoppy version of a Baltic porter. Who cares, its big, rich, hoppy and at 11%abv itll get you warmed up real fast.

Pours dark brown with a creamy off-white head. Aromas of dark fruit, chocolate, cherry, raisin, strawberry, piney hops, and leather. very, very rich. Mouth feel is thick with good carbonation. Taste is a bitter dark fruit explosion with roasted malt, dark chocolate, and tobacco. As with the nose, very rich and intense. Booziness is present but not unpleasant and adds some warmth. Finish is long and bitter leaving bitter hops, dark chocolate, and cherry. One of the best beers Ive ever had. A few reviews down, someone mentioned ketchup chips on the nose...hes right!

2012-05-04. Very dark brown body, small frothy beige head. Mild aroma, light malt is sort of dusty, malty,  modest alcohol. 7+ Flavour is similar, quite malty, modest alcohol throughout. Mild toasty malt accents, hint of caramel. Dry mildly alcoholic finish. Smooth average palate. Pretty simple, malt and alcohol dominate. Enjoyable but a bit much. Bottle from LCBO shared by HogTownHarry

Deep red-brown body with a big mocha head, wonderful retention.
Aroma is very sweet and even sticky: caramel, piney hops, vanilla, alcohol, cocoa.
Tastes super sweet caramel, maple syrup, combined with roasted malt and a good dose of hops, liquorish, alcohol tickling, oily mouth-feel.
A great brew, but not really my style.

750ml bottle. A deep mahogany, slightly pink pour with a pinkish head. Chocolate, hickory smoke, grain, leather and barnyard on the nose depending on the angle of the sniff. Starts sweet with a real savoury note that comes on and leads to a bitter smokiness. The finish goes through 9 to 12 different phases of bitter and sweet. At one point I started salivating like crazy for no reason.

big creamy brew sporting tan coloured head & has dark redish/brown color that is slightly pink.Big aromas, chocolate, dry grains, cereal, ketchup chips. Ive been told it reminds somebody of dry dog food, in a really descriptive way, so im going with that. Has a boozy taste, and simply one of the more complex brews ive ever had the chance of tasting. flavours start with a boozy, chocolate and creamy flavour but finishes slightly bitter. so amazing!

750mL bottle from LCBO.  Pours clear deep dark brown with a tan head.  Aroma of bread, chocolate, cherries, and bourbon.  Taste is sweet with burnt sugar, toast, some dark fruits, spice, smoke, and has a moderately bitter finish with an alcohol burn.  Full bodied with low carbonation.
Pours a silky black with a medium frothy light brown ring and some lacing.  Aroma of chocolate and dark malts.  Taste is loads of malt, chocolate with some pine hop bitterness.  Really nice beer.
dark coke-like pour. aroma of sugar, hop, pine, chocolate and some mint. big chocolately, malty, sugary and hoppy taste. very nice beer. 750ml from lcbo.

Bottle. Cola black, thick off white head. Aroma: deliciously hopped, marzipan, chocolate, fruit, spicy, pine, smells tremendous. Flavour: coffee, super hoppy, marzipan, delicious wood flavour, spruce, cinnamon, a little alcohol, long creamy chocolate coffee finish. Tons and tons of hops. Amazing.

0.75l bottle from LCBO. Pours an opaque brown, fine beige head. No visible carbonation. Aroma: Very strong muscatel notes. Also hints of orange, caramel, ginger, and some soy sauce. Palate: Full bodied. Thick, smooth. Clean finish. Taste: Fairly sweet. Slightly bitter in the finish. Wonderful beer.

UPDATED: APR 28, 2012 750ml LCBO bottle shared with jsprime. brown, tan head. big thick. burnt sugar, malty sweet nose. thickbody, quite sweet. will probably round into an awesome beer with 2 - 5 year of cellaring.
what a great beer. Everything i tried so far dorm Mikkeller as always been great, and this is anther exemple.

750 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a very dark brown with moderate-sized tan head.  Aroma is dark slightly sour fruit, molasses and roasted malt .  Flavour is also rich, sweet malt with prunes, raisin, molasses, bread and an underlying roastiness.  Found it a little off-putting at first but I warmed to it.  Or maybe that was the 11%.  Big body.  An interesting beer.

Egad! Such a beer! Huge and rich, pours a dark ruby with a big clingy head. Aroma is sugary sweet with burnt underpinnings. Nice body. Taste is gorgeous... Like a freshly-baked flan, with a hint of cherry and a fruity bitterness. I only picked up one bottle of this originally, but I will be back for more.

UPDATED: APR 19, 2012 750mL bottle that I probably shouldnt have got into tonight, nor purchased in the first place. Pours a hazy, dark reddish brown with a large beige head. Aroma is full of fruity malty aspects, as well as that weird, sweet malty character that I get from Mikkeller that is kind of hard to describe but always reminds me of tasting sessions that have gone way too far. Flavour is your standard malt bomb, vague Bock elements thrown in with arguably overly sweet Mikkeller malt aspects. Too much booze on the palate, just staring you right in the face. Dark fruits and what not blah blah blah. Pretty much every beer I have from this brewery is either over-attenuated and tastes like ink, or like this, possibly under-attenuated and loaded with residual and un-fermented sugars. Call me a dick, but everything Ive had from them seems like they need to severely restrain themselves, or more importantly, REFINE THE EVER-LOVING F*** OUT OF THEIR BREWING TECHNIQUES. For how many pointless collaborations they seem to do, they never seems to learn anything, and always end up with the same shit regarding their own brews. Jesus Fucking Christ, Protestant or Catholic. There is some complexity here, but it seems merely coincidental. Also, stop charging $600 a bottle and maybe youd be on the right track. Mikkeller, because of you, I generally dont bother with Danish beers any more because I know Ill probably end up disappointed. Its like, "Hey, heres an awesome beer style that doesnt get much appreciation. Lets just take a massive dump all over everything it stands for! Yeah!".

750ml bottle 
11.0% ABV 
I tried this beer on April 13, 2012 after purchasing from the Royal Bank Plaza LOCBO outlet in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a sold dark brown colour with a long lasting foamy dark tan coloured head.  Aroma was dark fruit, yeast, roasted malt, and brown sugar.  The mouthfeel was full-bodied, and creamy.  The flavour had molasses, brown sugar, roast, and a definite wood flavour to it.  Very enjoyable.

alcohol, very dark and hazy, frothy head.  Initially, I found to have a very boozy taste to it but it rounded nicely after that.  The more I drank the more it grew on me.  Pretty happy that it has come to the LCBO!

750mL bottle from the LCBO.  Pours a dark brown, not quite black. with tan head that lingers for a decent amount of time.  Roasted malts, bit of yeast on the nose.  Just a hint of carbonation to keep it from being lifeless, body is a touch thin but not really an issue.  Heavy on the malts and some unexpected mellow fruit sweetness, raisins/prunes?  Gives way to a bready, astringent and boozy finish.  Could possibly benefit from some aging as the ethanol finish was a little too sharp for my liking.

Wow an odd duck. In a good way. Cloudy brown, golden highlights, with a puffy tan head that fades. Aroma of raisins and a bit of demerara play out in the flavors, with a strong taste of dry hops and some assertive alcohol. Dark-bready flavors, a bit of salt and mineral, and a wine-like feel. Hooray Mikkellers in Ontario!!

750mL bottle from the LCBO. Pours a dark brown, pretty much black, with some tan head that forms quickly and stays around a bit. Smells like complex bread, but fruity, raspberries I think? Palate is a bit thin, but carbonation is spot on. Tastes like bread. Really good malty flavour with a good balance of hops, exactly what a doppelbock should be.

750 mL bottle.  Gushed a bit upon opening, and I could smell the heavy, dark bread immediately.  There is something more there as well; perhaps a touch of alcohol, a touch of hops, some cocoa powder.  The taste is interesting; it has all of the doppelbock elements, but that is only a part of the flavour.  Its like a big, boozy, hoppy doppelbock.  With anise and fruit added to make it even more interesting.  I really like this one.

Pours a deep dark brown, large head reduces to a thin lacing, aroma of forest fruits with a bit of alcohol. Tastes of roast fruits, pine , a bit of banana, some grapefruit and some alcohol. Very nice balance and does not feel 11% abv.
Poured very deep brown with wispy head. Tastes of wonderful malts but is a tad hot with the 11%.

Label on the back describes this as "strong malt liquor" which does a major disservice.  Pours very dark brown with ample foam.  Aroma is big, as you might expect.  Major bready malts, plus raisin, leather, dried fruits.  It wouldnt surprise me if there was some roasted barley in there - I got the occasional gulp that was quite toasty/stouty.  Taste is big, sweet, but balanced, with a very chewy mouthfeel.  Only complaint is the alcohol was a bit hot.
Bottle......it pours dark brown almost mahogany with a medium off white head.... The aroma is sugar, hops, malt..... The flavor is dark malts, hoppy, brown sugar and some fruity..... Full body.....

Draught @ The Mikkeller Bar. Pours very dark reddish brown with a small off-white head that slowly dissipates without leaving much trace. Smell is sweet, tiny sour and very malty and fruity with dark bread, plums, raisins, very ripe apricots, wood, minerals, spices and a big dose of alcohol. Taste is very sweet, slightly bitter and fruity with dark bread, caramel, bread spices, wood, prunes, raisins, hints of minerals and lots of alcohol. Mouthfeel is boozy, intense and full bodied. Finish is sweet, slightly bitter, malty and fruity.

750ml from the Perfect Pour, Elkridge, MD. Was curious to see what these quirky folks to do with one of the most hidebound of styles. As usual, its not quite what one would expect. Oily brownish/rust pour with just a smidge of carbonation to liven up the murk. Big, assertive flavors of heavy malts, tons of raisin, and some notes both tart and smoky that come across just a bit odd. Salt peanuts!

75cl bottle, shared with friends.; ours a dark brown with a tan bubbly head. Smells of candi sugar, roasted malts and dark red dried fruits. Tastes roasted, with a heavy sweetness and medium bitter with a long duration. Texture is oily. Soft carbonation. Finishes bitter. Nice, in your face version of a doppelbock.

Draught at Tadgs. Dark brown with orange tints and a fine, thick, lovely head. Huge malt nosetons of caramel, raisins, chocolate. Creamy malt flavor, dried fruits, some licorice, and a hugely bitter finish with tons of hops mixing with alcohol. Excellent sipper.

Tap @Mikkeller Bar 26/2/2012. Poured dark brown with a thin beige head. Aroma has alcohol, bready malt and caramel. Flavor very similar, bread and caramel as well as some alcohol biting in the finish. Heavy doppelbock.

(Draught at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen, 16 Feb 2012) Deep ruby colour with frothy, beige head. Fruity, malty nose with caramel and red fruit, slightly vinous. Malty, fruity taste with notes of caramel, red fruit, a touch of raspberries and a slightly vinous, but still excellently balanced, finish with a certain spicy bitterness. Almost full body, with some sweetness. Very nice balance, despite the fairly high abv. Excellent beer.

Squealer off draught @ International Beer Shop, W. LeedervilleIt looks oily in the glass but not viscous or big in body. Reasonable clarity shows in the brownish, ruby-tinged shallows. The body a midnight brown with very little evident carbonation. Head was nowhere to be seen. Boozy, heavily spiced nose, really penetrating with hints of caramelised figs, dates, sultanas and raisins. Oily and sweet in the mouth, very warming and peaty. Lots of musty and ashen wood notes, smoke lingers, some bitter raisin and burnt sugar on the swallow. Becomes cloying and gammy quickly. Hot, vinous, port-like feel as it passes the tonsils. Really uninteresting to be honest. Body, feel, carbonation, all doesnt pull together. Drinkable in small doses, the aroma is a winner though!

14/II/2012 75cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ Klaas place - BB: 31/3/12 (2012-130) Thanks to Klaas for sharing the bottle!
Clear purple brown beer, small irregular beige head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: dried fruits, sweet malts, milk chocolate, fruity touch, chloride (swimming pool!) and some alcohol. MF: low carbon, full body. Taste: dried fruits, sweet caramel, sugar, alcohol, chocolate, slight hint of mocha. Aftertaste: caramel, bitter chocolate, some acidity, bit of hops.

500ml bottle pours a reddish brown color with a 2 finger off-white head that leaves some spotted lacing on the glass.  Aroma is caramel malts and chocolate with some aromatic hops and dark fruits.  Taste is light roast malt bitterness balanced nicely with caramel malt and dark fruit sweetness finishing with some mild hop bitterness in the finish.  A very well done doppelbock style beer and highly recommended.

Clear very dark reddish brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, heavy malty, caramel, dried fruit and moderate hoppy. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. Oily and smooth. 160212

Tap.  Opaque, brown body with red/orange hue.  Small ring of a head, stays a ring, and doesnt lace.  Look is OK, but the aroma is lovely.  Dark fruits, dark malts, some estery yeasty fruitiness, and a generally rich and delicious aroma.  Body is awesome.  Velvety carbonation, fullish, not at all sticky with a great finish.  Fantastic.  Flavor is a continuation of the aroma, fairly malty, but not really sweet.  A dark, fruity monster of a bock and its tastily complex and lovely.

On tap at Night after Monsters. Pours a dark amber with small creamy beige head leaving sticky lacing along the glass. The aroma is molasses and chocolate roast. Thin mouthfeel with a sweet roast raisin and chocolate. Alcohol present but not overpowering. A very good doppelbock from Mikkeller.

Bottle. Pours dark brown with a faint red tint and foamy, beige head; great retention and lacing. Aroma is toffee, roasted malt, caramel, and light toast. Flavor matches the nose with additional yeast and chocolate notes. Medium/full body, medium carbonation, and medium/high warmth. Great beer.

Bottle.  Pours clear dark brown with ruby highlights and an average to large, frothy tan head, medium-short retention with good lacing.  Aroma is heavy caramel and nutty malt, dates and figs, earthy hops, alcohol, and spices.  Flavor is malt dominant, alcohol, dark fruits, light hops and bitterness with a sweet finish.  Full body, high warmth and medium carbonation.

On tap at the Bavarian Lodge, Lisle IL., and served to a house logoed, stemmed glass with a ruby highlighted, dark brown color, a silky, lasting, brownish tan head, and sheet-like cling to the lacing. The flavor added just enough lingering hop bitterness to add to the complexity, slight tartness, a light creaminess to the mouthfeel, and warming but nicely disguised alcohol content, all in a medium-full body. A very satisfyingly smooth Doppel.

I did not understand the "triple Bock" but it really a decent doppelbock but more massive.

Ruddy red-brown color with a modest off-white head. The nose is of toasted malts, raisins, dark fruits. The taste is huge, toasty bitterness balanced by brown sugar. The mouthfeels full, a bit oily, and a bit alcoholic. An aggressive beer, quite good.
Very salty, dark fruits, fizzy, rough. Musky, dark, salted caramel. Cottony, to salty for me, taste like an old ale.

Tasted on 12/17/11 from a corked and caged 750mL bottle purchased at Discount Liquor.  Pours an opaque dark brown with a thick tan head that slowly recedes to thin, bubbly, spotty lace.  The nose is malty milk and dark chocolate with some underlying vanilla, burnt brown sugar bitterness, and a ton of alcoholic heat.  The flavor is more of the milk and dark chocolate with a salted caramel note, some burnt brown sugar bitterness, vanilla, and some alcoholic heat.  The body is full and oily with just lighter than average carbonation and a very long, hot, salted caramel, dark chocolate, and lightly bitter finish.

750 ml bottle from Bieropholie, shared with the gang at Mikes, served cool in a tulip glass. 20NO11.

Keg. Clear red brown color with a big froathy head. Aroma is a mixture of caramel and fruits. Flavor is sweet malty, ltos of toffee and ripe fruit , some sugar and alcohol. Rather dry finsih.

A dark reddish brown bock with a thick brown head. In aroma, a smooth molassey malt with brine and soy notes, light woody notes, some light peppery notes. Black pour. Medium-sized light tan head. Stays for some time and leaves a little bit of lacing. Big bready malt aroma. Slightly fruity. Big sweet bread and malt taste. Caramel, licorice, more molasses, excellent. Good carbonation, creamy at the same time, barely a hint of the 11% lurking in the dark. Fruity and dark, this is a great beer - a beer that I was putting off drinking. Excellent and highly drinkable.

750 ml corked and caged bottle poured a clear dark brown with a small lingering brown head. Aromas of molasses, carmel, toasted malt and earthiness. Palate was medium bodied and smooth with a dry finish. Flavors of molasses, toffee, carmel, earthiness and toasted malt with a smooth dry lingering molasses finish.
Draft @ RnH Mikkeller event. Dark pour with almost no head. Dark malts, some fruits, with a dry finish. A little boozy in the nose that doesnt turn over into flavor.

Extreme dark brown body with a thick brown cap, yummy rich smelling malt, sweet and chocolaty. Alcohol is mild in the nose this aroma is making me drool. Yum yum taste.  So thick so smooth.chocolate arglamvreeee. There is a bitter kick off coffee with some ash. Yum so good..getting drunkeryum yum yuuuuuummmmmmmmmmmmm..drooooooool. brown sugar......fig.... head swimmingtasty smooth yum. Great beer and it knocks you on your ass.

Deep, dark mahogany, bubbly brown head, early lace. Aroma of booze and burnt sugars. Flavours of molasses, brown sugar, hints of raisins and wood. Sweet, but with a surprisingly bitter end. Delicious.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle.  Pour is deep rich brown with a medium light brown head.  Very powerful look to this beer.  Aroma is loaded with roasted caramel malt.  Tons of it.  Also light fruity notes, faint coffee, light smoke, and faint licorice.  Flavor is lots of roasted malt, but not as much as expected.  Also a light dryness with notes of brown sugar and coffee in the finish.  Less sweet and more well rounded than expected.  Also a faint hop note.  Really hides 11% well.  Only a faint alcohol note.

Pours a dark thick gem, with white head that leads to alce.  From private buying club.  Big bold roasty aromas.  Bold taste of roast, coffee and chocolate.  Not too thick, still quite drinkable.  Alcohol well hidden but it warms the body and then fogs the brain.  Amazing meal in itself.

Bottle.  Pours a brune body with an off white head and poor head retention.  Etoh creeps out first with a dark fruit tone, caramel, fig, sherry notes.  Licorice and rye with a mild caramel tone.  Soy and malt sweetness.  Pretty boozy finish.  Eh.

200ml from tap at Mikkeller Bar in Copenhagen. Deep and shiny mahogany coloured body. Bare naked surface. Spiced aroma with malts and a touch of almond. Dusty hops and spiced chocolate malts in flavour. Dry and lingering in the throat. A varied and flavoursome brew, 05.11.2010.

Sampled @ Copenhagen Beer Festival 2010. Clear, reddish brown body with a medium size brown head. Aroma of sweet malt, dry fruit and coffee. Flavor is sweet malt,chokolate, dry fruit, nuts and hops. Fine balanced body, bitter finish and well-hidden alcohol. A solid brew.

750mL bottle.  Poured deep brown with a tall, creamy, well-retained beige head.  The aroma picked up warm darker fruits, molasses, and some coffee, with a sweet overall impression.. some hints of warmth around, but the sugars led.. well-balanced.  The flavor found more of the molasses and sticky caramel at the core.. prickly, peppery alcohol and malty sourness (molasses and some coffee) emanated outward.. a little too sour and sharp.. warmed up the belly and left a molasses impression on the finish.  Heavier-bodied and sweet on the palate.. nice creamy feel on the front, but the sourness after that didnt work so well.. chewy.  This was a solid brew that may benefit from age.
Bottle from Voldby. Nice head with good duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are rich malt, dried fruits, caramel and hops.
Bottle from Healthy Spirits. Pours black with a thick tan head and a strong treacle and coffee aroma. There is a thick sweet dark malt flavor with a very dry bitter finish. A marvelous brew.

750ml Bottle:  Aroma of malt, toasting, light burnt caramel, nuts, slight dried fruit, and slight raisin.  Poured very seep amber/brown in color with a medium-sized, creamy, dense, tan/beige head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Clear but lightly cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of tiny particles throughout.  Excellent lacing.  Flavor is light to medium sweet.  Tastes of malt, tar, wood, roasting, slight caramel, and slight tobacco.  Medium to full body.  Viscous, smooth, creamy texture is a little dry.  Soft to average carbonation.  Malt, tar, wood, slight caramel, and slight tobacco finish is dry.  11%ABV is completely hidden throughout.

Shared at Cafe Viking, Nørrebro, Copenhagen. Close to an ultimate imperial bock, heavy, but disguised alcohol. Nice head, medium carbonation.  Hazelnuts, caramel and smooth hoppyness, balances well with the malts. Two sips and i was hooked.

750 c&c. Pours very dark ruby with a 3 finger foamy tan head. Aroma is like cola and medium dark reddish fruit. Full bodied with near creamy carbonation. Its very fruity - like dark cherry? Its very malty. And I think Im getting chocolate and coffee. Heat? Gotta search for it. Extremely tasty.

750 ml bottle from Wine and Cheese Place.  Pours a cloudy reddish-brown color with a beige head.  Aroma of caramel malts, toast, cola, nuts, brown sugar, graham cracker, and nuts.  Flavor of chocolate and caramel malts, nuts, brown sugar, toast, cola, leaves, dried fruits, and grass.  I have scribbled down that there was something vaguely "Euro" in this beer but not sure if I was referring to the malts or hops.  Medium-bodied, with mild carbonation and a toasty, malty mouthfeel.  One of the guys drinking this was calling it a "triple bock", as its an imperial doppelbock, more or less.  The booze is hidden in the nose and flavor, though, and its a cool beer.

750ml bottle.  The pour yields a deep, inky, violet-burgundy body with a thin, bubbly head of dark khaki froth.  A solid, unbroken sheet of lacing coats the glass almost entirely.  The aroma is loaded with dark fruits, overflowing with stewed raisins and figs in the forefront, followed by some tempered cocoa roast, toasted tree nuts, and some boozy, sherry-like character.  Earthen hops are present, but primarily serve a backup role to the mostly sweet fruitiness.  Flavors comes through with monstrously sweet caramel malt, again with dark, stewed, concentrated raisins, figs, and dates.  Toasted nuts, mild hops, and some earthy, dry, yeasty bread are all that keep this from being over-the-top sugary.  The palate sports a big body that is thinned only by the excessive alcohol, which brings a warm to hot, boozy finish.  Carbonation is moderate an unobtrusive.  Overall, there is good fruit depth and some supportive roast character, but the sweetness and booziness ultimately serve as detractors.  Decent, but far from great.
Nose of sweet hazel, mild hops, feel is elegant, balance of carb and winefeel, taste is weak alcohol, plum, late sweet licorice.

Draft during CBC Chicago.  Pours a clear dark rich mahogany with a frothy light tan head.  Nutty aroma, vinous, rich, bit of toast, old ale, nutty.  Flavor is same but more hoppy, nutty, more chocolate and roast, touch of something tart, especially in the finish, a bit of that palsticy yeast and pine character, hides the alcohol beautifully, cherry notes.  Medium bodied, fluffy carbonation, not sticky, drinks very well.

Sampled on 10/8/2010. This dopple/triple bock pours a dark brown color from a 750ml corked and caged bottle. Small to medium sized white foamy head with nice retention and good lacing. Aroma is malty, bready and sweet, touches of brown sugar and raisins. A medium to full bodied dopplebock. The malts are caramel, bready, hints of chocolate and cookie. The hops are earthy. Nice carbonation. A touch of alcohol bite, but not bad for 11%. Very nice sipping beer. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

750 ml "champagne" bottle, kindly shared by my beerpal Christian. ABV is 11%. "Triple Bock" with Hallertauer and Horizon hops. Very dark ruby colour, nearly black. Big to moderate beige head. Oaky aroma, notes of dark dried fruits, vinous notes. Oaky flavour, much the same elements as the aroma, but not too sweet. Distinct hoppy bitterness in the finish.

750ml bottle, dark mahogany-ruby color, with a tan pillowy head, leaving some laces, nice toasted, caramelized, wheat, malt, fruity, cookie dough nose with some oatmeal soft cookie, toffee, brown sugar, molasses fruitcake accents, with some hints of black coffee and english pudding and some leafy, grassy, minty hop aromas follow through on a full-bodied palate with a warmth, toasted, caramelized, chocolate, dark malt, fruity character with some light black coffee, faint spicy anise, burnt fruitcake flavors, with some flowery hop leafy, grassy, minty undertones and some hints of green molasses and dark bitter chocolate, leading towards a warming, bitter chocolate, roasty, leafy, grassy hop bitterness finish.

Bouteille de 750 ml, avec bouchon de liège,  obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Légère odeur de caramel fruité avec une pointe chocolatée. Apparence: La couleur est brune opaque avec une faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col beige  mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de caramel avec une pointe de figues et dalcool. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement fruité. (Rating #3283)

(750ml bottle, BB 31/03/12)  Pours a mahogany body with a dense medium beige head.  Aroma of raisins, chocolate, caramel, bread, and light citrus notes.  Flavor of raisins, vinous, plum, caramel, roasted grain, and grass with a dry finish.

A very, very dark bock - think Celebrator- that produces a fine, sticky beige head. Explosive munich character in the nose feels like whole-grain bread, milk chocolate and roasted nuts. Dates and prunes fruitiness remain in the background. Fusel touches get kinda plasticy. It gets very alcoholic as it warms, initially containing its 11% impressively well, but heating up, becoming more insistent. Its saving grace has got to be its relatively balanced sweetness-dryness ratio. It is very sweet indeed, but far from the levels of its peers - Samichlaus and its descendants. The finish is mostly about alcohol, lingeringly so and the shy leafy hops remain a non factor. I reckon this is pretty well done and actually almost top of its slim class of very strong dark lagers, but it does not have much of what I look for in a beer: an enveloping freshness, feeling the ingredients, focus-or-complexity, etc.
Oh how I love me some triple bock. chocolate caramel nose, little mint. darkest brown, tan creamy head. Dry dark chocolate, Chicory, little chili spice. tight encapsulated body.

Bottle: Poured a deep amber color ale with a large foamy head with good retention and some very good lacing. Aroma of caramel malt with notes of warming alcohol and light caramel notes. Taste is also a nice enough mix between some caramel malt with light fruity ester. Body is about average with good carbonation and some alcohol was apparent. OK but still quite different from some staple of the style  lacking some ester that I usually associate with the style.

Draught @ Pikkulintu. Dark brown, slightly translucent with a medium-sized tan head. Sweetish malty scent with impressions of chocolate and coffee. Medium-bodied and averagely carbonated. Flavour comprises roasted malt, coffee, caramel and dark fruits and spices along with hoppy bitterness. A delightful beer: I received my Saviour with joy.

This beer is awesome. It pours black with a nice tan froth that lingers for quite a while. Nose is cocoa, and a touch of hops. On the palate the cocoa is front and center for me. Great hop backbone gives a good balance between hops and malt.

Pours dark brown, with golden crown... malty and somewhat sweet in the nose. taste is sweet, malty, notes of burnt caramel that lasts long in the mouth
caramel, tofee, hazelnut are just some of the expressions I get from this beer.. I would love to try it with som food, maybe some pork roast...

Tap @ Olutravintola Pikkulintu.
Pours a brown, slightly transparent colour. Thick, creamy and medium-sized head with a natural white colour. Slightly fruity aroma with notes of oak, caramel and nuts. Light sweet taste of caramel malts, syrup and mild roastiness. Medium bodied, oily and sticky mouthfeel. Nice Doppelbock.

(Draught at Pikkulintu) Poured deep dark brown and clear. Head was medium sized and light brown. Aroma contained chocolate, malts and sweetness. Palate was full bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were malts, roastedness, hint of spices, coffee, grain and bitterness. Aftertaste was malty, grainy and bitter.

Its black with a red hue and a huge, light-brown, creamy and lasting head. The aroma has notes of caramel, malt and dark fruits. The flavour is very sweet but is nicely balanced by hops. It has notes of caramel, malt, grapefruit, fruit, dried dark fruits, alcohol and the finish is dry and slightly bitter.
