pour is near black with a big ol head of grey that lasts. doubt ill get through this tonight. been going for 17 hours and i can see the end of the line. at least ill a have a breakfast beer. this is not a beer, it is a syrup, thick goodness. smells of roast, maple, a bit of smoke(could be the 4 mile fire, but i think it is the beer.) and watermelon. damn this is tasty. nice roast and sweet balance. caramel notes all over without being too sweet. some vanilla and a great warming alcohol throughout. peanut finish that has a lot of a lot of honey flavors, like a candy i used to love as a kid. bit-o-honey in beer form. good times.

Pours ebony into a stem glass. Mocha head with excellent retention recedes leaving spider lacing to coat surface. Dusty tangerine aromas. Sweet milk chocolate covered summer fruits upfront continuing to a lasting choco alcohol burn finish.

Bottle. Aroma of hops, caramel and roasted malt. Dark brown colour with high, soft light brown head. Flavour of roasted, burnt malt with some smoked wood and fruits. Dry, long lasting bitter and smoked finish.
Draft. Color dark red/black with big head. Aroma smoke, herbs, caramel, roasted malt. Taste bread, alcohol, coffe, smoke, dark fruits.

Huge dense beige head, quite stable, over cola-coloured beer. Very rich alcoholic nose, with cake, parsley and lots of dark malts However, less "clean" than bottom fermenting usually yields. Dry, bitterish, near severe main taste, notwithstanding a subtle, but very real sweet-malty presence in the background. Alcohol, bread, and a spiciness remindful of colaflavour, but without any syrupy sweetness. And above all, an impressive balance. Medium to well-bodied, and very slick. Discreet (certainly for its ABV) alcoholwarming, only gradually increasing. If anything, the balance of this beer impresses me.

My Bottom Line:
This Imperial Stout-meets-Doppelbock proposes Munich and chocolate malts along raisiny caramel, while alcohol heat and herbal hop bitterness seal each sip with authority.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam tops the brown-hinged blackness.
-Even though this is a mighty brew, it is not too sweet (which I appreciate).
-The soft effervescence makes each rather easy drinking for an 11% lager.
-This is as well executed as any other Mikkeller brew, but the recipe itself is not as compelling as some of his best work.

Bottle.
Blood red/black pour. Aroma has a lot of herbs and a bit smokey notes. Taste is rich with liqorice and coffee liqueur. Nice full body.

Pours dark brown with red at the edges and a creamy tan head. Aromas of caramel, brown sugar, some dark fruit, and booze. Flavor is lots of sweet malt, fruit, some roasty notes, and a good bit of bitterness.

Big thanks to Blazer06 for another Mikkeller treat. Pours murky rutty mahogany with mocha head. The aroma puts out spicy black licorice, black strap molasses, a bit of roast, a mild amount of dark fruity esters and a wafer thin ring of sweet nuttiness rounded things out. The taste is smooth to start with a pulse of chocolate and sweet malts to go along with growing rich sweet dark fruity esters. By midway a black licorice note, some spiciness and chocolate all join in to take this to the finish. Yummy beer that goes above and beyond most of this style Ive had before.
Bottle. Pours a dark amber brown color with a small off-white head. Has a sweetish malty hoppy caramel aroma. Sweetish malty hoppy dark fruit and caramel flavor. Has a sweetish malty hoppy finish.

Aroma:Light pine hops aroma...
Appearance:Dark brown,good head....
Flavor:pine hops,alcohol,honey.....

Deep brown pour.  The nose is fairly sweet with a little bit of salty character.  Soy-like chewiness.  A soft toastiness in addition to a bit of plummy fruit.  Salty/savoury character on the back.  Full-bodied and a little bit chewy.  Kind of odd, but its okay.
Draft.  Dark hazy brown, tan edge head.  Aroma of caramel.  Taste is butterscotch, chocolate and prominent alcohol.  Nice.
750 from Jarret. Chocolate and malty taste. Little milk chocolate in there. Alcohol in the nose. Bit of caramel. Tasty.
bread, roasty, black, brown foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,
Dark brown almost black. Has an off-white head, mostly lasting. Deep malty aroma, faint orange-notes, roasted, faint chocolate. Flavor is heavy sweet, finish moderate bitter finish. Syrupy texture.

25.4 oz bottle.  Dark brown with a fluffy beige head.  Nose is chocolate, raspberry jam and brown sugar.  Almost full body with a tang.  Taste is bittersweet chocolate, sour cherry and caramel with a bitter grassy finish.  Rich and satisfying.  I would have never guessed this was a doppelbock.
75 cl bottle, pours dark with minimal head, aroma is caramel and malt, taste is sweet malt, caramel and brown sugar with a slightly roasted feel.

On tap at KØ-10. Its a dark brown beer topped by a small, dense beige head. The aroma is sweetish, with some dried fruits and chocolate, and a nice hoppyness. The flavor is quite bitter and also sweet, with dried fruits and chocolate. Nice bitterness in the end. Warming and full-bodied. A pleasant one, more bitter than most doppelbocks, but it suits it. 100506

(750ml bottle best by 3/31/12 thanks to blutt59) clear rich deep brown, creamy tan head. Nose of raisin, alcohol, caramel and honeydew. Taste of toasty raisin, oranges, candied fruit, and caramel. Finish is dry, nearly powdery with a linger of citrus.
Dark brown with a light brown fluffy head.  Chocolate, alcohol, and sugar aroma.  Smooth palate with a good chocolate, sugar, mild molasses, and caramel taste.

Thanks to blutt59 for sharing this bottle.

The beer pours a brown color with red highlights and a tan head. The aroma is roasted malt, toffee, dark fruit and a little bit of something that resembles trash. The flavor is dark fruit, toffee, roasted malt and surprisingly, no alcohol. The beer is very dry. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
bottle thanks to blutt59.   poured a deep brown/ruby with a khaki head.  nose is fruity malts, vanilla, and very sweet. smooth on the palate, flavor is roasted malts, with a roasty finish.
bottle, thanks to SS, black brown pour with creamy tight foam, clean plum and nuts aroma, flavors of sweet refined sugar, dark fruits, raisin bread

UPDATED: APR 30, 2012 Bottle thanks to someone at sourfest. Pours with a brown body and a tan head that stays. Aroma of brown sugar, raisins and a bit of hop character. Taste is brown sugar, and herbal with a lot of caramel and some dark fruits. Lively bubbles, a decent amount of alcohol.  Rerate:
Hazed deep brown body with a minimal tan head. Aromas are of deep caramelization, melanoidins, raisins, alcohol and leather. Flavors are of leather, booze, hugely bitter, earthy, raisins, boozy, soil. Very big bodied, warming.

Bottle Pours mostly clear and nearly black (deep ruby when held up to light) with a small, creamy, off-white head. Good retention. The bouquet is nutty, chocolaty and lightly vinous  medium sherry. Full-bodied and creamy with moderate carbonation. The flavor is chocolaty and vinous with only a rumor of coffee. Sweet; then bitter. Finishes carbonaceous and mildly bitter with a hint of acidity at the wee end. Kudos to jtclockwork for shipping this bottle my way!

UPDATED: SEP 20, 2010 It pours with a deep garnet color with a full, pillowy, fluffy, tan head which is mostly diminishing and leaves some scattered lace.  The nose is still premature but still bursting with flavor; spicy phenols, some herbal/perfumey hop notes, fruit cake, candied currants, caramel, almonds, and light roast.  The flavor is much different with more of the dark malt notes and less fruity esters and hops; toasted almonds are prominent, mild coffee roast, dark breads, toasted caramel, light currant notes, faint herbal hops, and still a chocolate cake tinge.  The palate is warm, nearly full, soft to lively, and velvety, almost round (in time, I think the palate could be perfect).  The finish is very long with toasted almonds, mild coffee, chocolate cake, and an herbal hop bitterness that stays on the tongue.  A wonderfully interesting beer with a flavor that was completely different from the nose.  The moderate bitterness to the beer was only noticed seconds after the finish because the flavor seemed to be completely malt dominated.  If only I had waited another year to pop this one; it was a bit young still but things are coming together nicely.  I am a bit curious about the label which says, "trippelbock"; I would take that to mean a Belgian trippel brewed in the bock style, but I guess with the 11% it could mean a triple bock.  Either way it contained great characteristics of both and Mikkeller again surprises me with another great beer.  I guess I am required to get another one to cellar and try next year sometime despite the price.

Bottle courtesy of hopscotch.  Pours mahogany with a nice aroma of sweet malt and dried fruits.  The taste was pleasant.  Sweet maltiness and dark fruits with a champaign kinda bubbly carbonation.  Good stuff..

Im not the biggest fan of doppelbocks but this one was pretty impressive. The color was dark with a subtle off white foamy head. It had aromas of malt, barely,  dried fruits, and  herbs. After trying this one Im a little more excited to get a hold of more doppelbocks.

Bottle from State Line.  Pours deep brown w 3f tan head.  Nose is dark roasty malt, hops, molasses, cacao, figgy fruit.  Tastes very dark malty, with molasses, brown sugar, fig, hoppy, estery, lactic.  Some late heat and creaminess.
Sampled on tap at SIB, pours dark brown / black. Aroma of sweet roasted malt, fruit, sweetness and alcohol. Flavour follows accordingly. Fantastic.

On tap at the Brick Store Pub. At first glance, I thought this was a stout. Its a very dark purple color, with a minimal head. The aroma is mainly fruit and alcohol. It tastes like vinegar, with a wine-like fruit flavor. It is sweet, with very little hops bitterness. The mouthfeel is light, and made little impression on me. Overall, an interesting beer.

Draft at Brick Store Pub. Pours deep but brilliant - dark ruby brown with a hint of purple (like a cool-hued garnet). Thin offwhite head. Thick, vinous, chewy, tangy malt aroma. Tangy malt sweetness in the flavor. Rich dark fruit (raisin cakes) with hints of chocolate. Full sweet finish with fruity malts. Mouthfeel is full, almost syrupy, with very strong carbonation, which does a good job of adding a sense of levity to the full texture. Overall, a very thick and rich, malty brew - but a bit too sweet.

Draught at Copenhagen Beer Festival.  Dark brown, minimal head. Sweet and full bodied with clean syruåy mouthfeel. Dense and caramelly, a bit edgy and sticky. Low bitterness. Too much power, feels aggressive and rough.

Bottle. Mahogony beer with a nice tan head. Malt and toffee aroma with light dried fruit. Malt and caramel/toffee flavor with figs/dates. Medium-plus bodied. Figs/dates linger with caramel/toffee and light cocoa.

750 ml bottle.Pours a dark brown with a coffee colored head.Nose is sweet malts and dark fruits with a hint of toastiness.Taste is creamy maltiness with rich flavors prevalent throughout.Very drinkable 11%.Not my favorite style but still a decent brew.

Tap at Paradiso. Pours a clear, deep ruby red with little head and decent beige lacing. Red licorice nose- very like Salvator actually. Taste is very syrupy sweet up front and then moves to a forest floor, herbal, medicinal bitterness that I get with some of these Danish style beers. Not really a hoppy bitterness. More like a throw everything you can find that is somewhat bitter into the primary to balance out such a sweet base beer. After it warms it gradually improves to taste like old flan syrup.

UPDATED: AUG 29, 2011 Tap at Rattle n Hum. Pours dark brown with a slight, off-white head. Some malt in the aroma, along with candy and dates. Flavor is outrageously sweet, with molasses, some grape, light caramel and tons of raisin. Flavor struck me as similar to that of a barley wine. Thick in body, a little syrupy. Lingering sweetness and stickiness in the finish. Not too shabby. (3.7)

On tap at the Craft Beer Co., London. Lots of malted barley in the nose. Pours clearish amber with a tight, light tan head. Sweet as shit, tons of malty sugars, mild caramel, some ripe fruits. Full bodied with average carbonation. Warm finish, more malt sweetness, candy, mild toffee, brown sugar. Very delicious. (4.1)
Draft. Pours deep brown with a beige head. Caramel malty aroma with some dark fruity sweetness. The flavor has a raisin/plummy dark fruity sweetness, caramel malts, and toffee. Good, not great.

[Draft @ 4th Ave Pub] Dark brown mahogany color with a small, light tan head that left light lacing on the glass.  Aroma of soy, oxidation, chocolate, roast, dark fruits, and alcohol.  Taste of caramel, chocolate, roast, figs, raisins, some smoke, and alcohol.

Dark  clear amber with light brown head. Excellent lacing. Alcohol, grassy, herbal, Dark syrup and dried dark fruit aroma. Alcohol, bitter, sweet, acidic flavors. Long finish carrying full flavor image. Full bodied and syrupy. Extreme but blanced, even though the alcohol is quite prominent.

750ml bottle.  very dark with ruby highlights under a large, foamy, tan head.  meaty, toasted malt, raisin aroma.  flavor has notes of caramel, soy sauce, chocolate, raisin.  finish in bitter sweet with a little warmth.  full body with moderate carbonation.  this is a meal in a bottle.

Bottle from De Molen brewery shop. Dark reddish brown with a lacing tan head. Chocolate, dried fruit, hints of cellar and port wine. Raisins, plums, dust, notes of chocolate. Alcohol. Soft, rather flat. An agreeable barley wine.

Tap @ Rattle n Hum, NYC.  The aroma is fruity, raisins, bready.  Very nice.  The appearance is deep mbrown, opaque, light tan head.  The flavor is bread, fruit, raisins, liht alcohol.  The fiunish is light noble hops, alcohol warming.  The body is medium to medium/thick.  Very good dopplebock.

Tap at Blind Tiger. Poured a deep black with a thin beige head. Nose is malty, roasted malty. First sip, wow! A flavor explosion. Lots of sweetness, and roasted malts. Dark fruits, rasberry. A bit sweet overall, with quite a bit of warmth. Nicely flavored and very drinkable,especially after a few others. A better closer than opener.

Draught at Blind Tiger. Very dark brown, basically black, with nice medium off white head. Aroma is raisin/dark dried fruit, artificial purple (not bad), big sweet malt backbone that hints at chocolate. Taste is sweet boozy dried fruit, light chocolate, somethings off though. Too boozy sweet for me, good though. Better warm.

Bottle. Creamy lightbrown excellent fully lasting head. Dark red-amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Light sweet and moderate bitter flavor with nice chocolate notes. Average moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Very good doppelbock.

courtesy of yespr - dark brown colour with a beige foam left; nutty and malty aroma with notes of ginger and apples; full-bodied and velvety mouthfeel with a fair bitterness; malty biscuity and hoppy finish - pretty complex and very nice

07-MAY-2010, @Beerfestival.dk.
Somewhat alcoholic (!)
Fruity very malty, and also bitter.
Sweet, sticky - sometimes I like bock:)
75 cl bottle. Brown body with off-white head. Flavour is malt, fruit, caramel and hops.

750ml Bottle. Dark coppery red pour with a creamy beige head that diminishes to surface cover fairly quickly. Aroma is rich, malty and sweet, with notes of toffee, raisins, brown sugar, dark rum and spicy, fruity hops. Flavour is similar to the aroma, sweet and bitter, malty and fruity. Sticky, creamy, mouthfeel with fairly low carbonation and a long finish that starts sweet, becoming more bitter. An excellent doppelbock that is not only great for regular drinking but also qualifies as something special. Really good, hope to see Mikkeller try more brews in a similar style.

Draft at Maxs, Fells Point: Poured a deep purplish/reddish/brownish color with a big off white head. Nose is rich and of ripe dark fruits, sweet caramel malts, yeast. Flavor is rich, plenty of raisin and dark fruit, sweet malts, and a nice light bitter finish. Very enjoyable.
Pours brown with a large beige head. Aroma is breaddy malt, fruity notes and light hop. Flavour is malr, high bitter hop. grassy hop. light fruity notes.
Big off-white creamy lasting head. Black body. Aroma of licorice, plums, hops and yeast. Full body and a oily texture. The taste is heavy sweet and light bitter.

Draft at belgian cafe in philly. Pours a dark brown body with no head. Aroma is chocolate sweetness, nut, and alcohol sharpness. Medium mouthfeel, with notes of sweet malt, nut, and sharp alcohol bite.

Had this brew at Belgian Cafe as my night cap. Enjoyed it very much. Pours a solid dark body with nice lasting head. The aromas and flavor had caramel, malts, and raisins in it. The alc was pretty well hidden although it created a surprising amount of action on my palate when I first sipped it.

Draft.  Medium beige head atop clear copper body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, caramel, some vinous, raisin, light earthy.  Taste is moderately sweet, caramel, some earthy, vinous/raisin.  Sticky medium-full body.
Bottle, 75cl. Pours a clear, dark burgundy beer with a beige head. The aroma is malt and sweetness. The flavor is malt, sweetness and spices. The palate is sweet. Overall a good balanced beer.

Bottle @ Odense Tasting, Feb 2010. Pours dark ruby brown with a beige lasting head and lacings. Nose is dark fruit, vahue roast and caramel. Flavor is a bit roasted with some chewy caramel and fruit. Smoothhh....
Draught at Lord Nelson.Dark reddish colour with no head.Aroma is sweet of spices and berries,moderate heavy mouthfeels and strong hidden alc,nice warming and nice beer.

Colore ambrato-rossastro , schiumamolto compatta come un cappuccino... ;-)
Equilibrate note etiliche ( anche se ha 11 gradi ) e soprattutto forti le note del malto molto caramellato.
Prevalente il sapore dolciastro che rimane per primo al palato con delle punte di amaro... eccezionale anche se non è il mio gusto preferito.

Draught at Ørsted Ølbar. Pours very dark reddish brown with an off white head. Crystal clear. The colour is a bit too dark for my taste but otherwise a nice appearance.
The aroma is very malty with caramel, fudge and dried fruit and a hop note, that is very present vis a vis the average Doppelbock but very downplayed for a Mikkeller beer.
On the palate there is nice carbonation to lift heavy malts and make this quite drinkable. Finishes more hoppy and with more bitterness than usual for the style, but it works very well with the sweet and malty flavours.

From Voldby, DK.
Bottled, 100110.
Brown with beige head. Aroma of much malt. Flavor is caramel malt with spices.

Draught @ Borefts Beer Festival 2009 - De Molen.Clear medium brown color with a average to large, frothy - creamy, good lacing, fully lasting, beige head. Aroma is heavy malty, caramel, heavy hoppy, grapefruit, dried fruit, licorice. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is moderate alcoholic. [20091030]

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2010 Bottle at the de-boned chicken tasting. Pours a hazy dark brown with an off-white head. Sweet and dry with hints of alcohol. Also hints of Belgian yeast and medicine. Medium to full bodied. Medium carbonation. Dry finish.

Dark brown with a big, tan head. Aroma of chocolate, fruits, especially apricot. Fruity sweet flavour with lots of hops and bitterness. Its a tasty beer, but not much of a bock. Lacks the malt depth. And while I dont rate to style I was hoping for a Mikkeller take on a classic doppelbock and as such a little disappointed
75cl, new exclusive Danish brew Anno 2009, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex brew, balanced, clear, good head, good brew

clear very dark amber, smooth large thick head.
spicy and slight sourish, sweeetish, slightly malty aroma, flowery hoppy, roasted grains.
id say aroma is a bit messy with the strange sourness not really matching the rest, but for sure its complex. alc well hidden in aroma.
flavor is licorice,roasted grains, honey, faint sweet malts, much sweeter profile than aroma, balanced by quite a lot of flowery and slightly piny , grapefruity hops. also a fruity note like dark berries or something. if there is any sourness it is very well hidden. more belgian than dobbeltbock id say. alc. well hidden. very strange brew, but quite tasty.
palate is oily. cool.

Hazy deep amber/brown look with a medium baige head. Strong malty aroma with lots of caramel, alchohol, bread and straw. Flavor is on the sweet side aswell with lots of alchohol to balance it out, leading to a warming finish. Nice one

Fad: Suverænt aftenens bedste øl. Rødbrun uigennemsigtig med et fint lille skumhoved. Duft af maltsødme og en god dosis humle. Smagen er igen bock med et tvist, nemlig rigelige mængder humle. Alkoholen får hele øllen til at balancere. Fantastisk.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2009 Bottle, 11.0%. Mild grassy aroma, seems to be quite malty as well. Clear dark red brown colour. Small stable tan head. The flavour is quite sweet, nicely spicy. There is a distinct alcohol note, a roasted touch. Quite bitter finish. Well-balanced.

Draught at Plan B, CopenhagenDark brown color; creamy head. Strange aroma, meaty; chicken. Good body structure; caramel flavor, quite sweet, light chocolate; just light alcohol perception; reasonably interesting, if it was not for the aroma...

UPDATED: FEB 4, 2010 Dec 9, 2009 : Draught at Plan B. Unclear brownish colour with a medium beige head. Aroma of caramel and fruits with malt. Good mouthfeel. The flavour is sweet with caramel, toasty malt, some fruity hops, alcohol and a soft bitterness. 7/3/7/4/14: 3,5
Feb 4, 2010: Botella @ home. Clear deep dark brown colour with a red hue. Big beige creamy bubbly well lasting head. Pleasant dark fruity sweet soft roasty malty aroma. Good mouthfeel. Pleasant dark fruity roasty malty bitter hoppy bit chocolate and alco flavour. Dry sweetish malty fruity hoppy pleasant finish.
Tasted at the first, great, Borefts Beer Festival 2009 @ De Molen. Ruby red colored brew. Roasted malts, raisins in the aroma. Flavor is malty, caramel, fruits. Nice.

Bottle. High fluffy and lasting light brown head leaving long lacings. Lovely clear ruby body. Malty caramel fruity cocoa aroma with a weak hint of alcohol. Relatively sweet and sour cocoa riasted malt flavor with little hops bitterness, low carbonation and a long sweet aftertaste.
Bottle. Dark brown with a dense off white head. Brown sugar, loads of malt, hops and dark fruit in aroma. The flavour is dark malty, light alcohol, hops, brown sugar and fruity. Nice creamy texture.

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of Ungstrup. Pours a clear orangey brown with a beige head leaving laces. Sweetish aroma of fruit and nutty malts. Strangely only appears medium-bodied, roasted malts and vitamin accents. A light alcohol burn in the finish. Not really convincing. 231109
Bottle at Sunes. Clear red/brown - offwhite head. Chocolate, fruity, bitterness, hoppy, nutty, ryebread, roasted, red berries, brown sugar, light fruity, caramel.

Bottled. Deep burgundy coloured. Grass, roast, sweetness, light spice and berries. Flavour of roast, spice, fruits, brown sugar, light yeast, grass. Medium to full bodied. Ends on a spiced and roasty bitterness.

Bottled. A hazy deep red beer with a huge brown head. The aroma has strong notes fruit, caramel, and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of caramel, alcohol, and lots of fruit, leading to a dry malty finish.

A Mes rate. Draught at 1st Borefts Beer Festival.Excellent mahogany colour with a thin beige head. Fruity malt a plenty with some really good resinous hoppage sticking out the top. Actually its amazingly fruity,packed full of berry notes all round. Given that it is so young its struggling a little to hold the resonably high level of alcohol back and therefore is a little on the raw side but Im sure that will pass. Nice toasty sugary notes in the finish. Yet another great beer from Mikkeller.
On tap at Borefts BF 09.  Very dark brown.  Drinkable brown ale tripel bock  Some heat on end.  Pretty good.
Tap @ Borefts Beer Festival 2009. Dark ruby red colour, tan head. Aroma is sour fruity, hoppy, malty. Flavour is of caramel malts and some spices.
Tap at BBF. Ruby body with small head. Nice nose of raisons and toffee. Taste of malts, caramel and quite sweet. But hoppy too. Well-balanced.

Tap @ 1st BBF, De Molen.
Pours deep ruby-red, bordering on brown with a small, creamy, off-white film head. Aroma is sweet, fruity, some raisins, lightly roasted and a heavy fruity hoppiness. Medium carbonation, nice creamy mouthfeel. Flavour is dry, caramel, lots of hops, light piney, pilsner malts. Very nice, good balance between sweetness and hops.
Tap @ BBF. Hazy amber color, medium off-white head. Aroma of caramel malt, hop, fruity, some toffee. Sweet taste, malty, caramel, bitter, fruity. Nice stuff.

On tap at the 1st BBF at De Molen. Beer poured a clear amber color with a decent tan head. Sweet malty nose with fruit tones. Taste was sweet and malty, dried fruit. There is also a nice hop bitterness at the back end to make for a well rounded beer.

Had this at the Borefts Beer Festival, De Molen Brewery, Bodegraven, Netherlands 30-10-09   This is lovely, lots of bitter toffee, there is a filmy head, good streaky hops showing with some dark bitter sugars, soft in the mouth, yum.  A8 A4 F8 P4 Ov16   4.0

Draught at 1st Borefts Beer Festival at De Molen.
Clear red brown coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of grain, dried fruits and liquorice with notes of hops.
Sweet flavour of caramel, dried fruits, grass, hops, pine needles and alcohol.
Dry hoppy and warming alcoholic finish.

On tap @ 1st BBF, de Molen. Aroma has fruity hops, caramel malts. Clear, dark amber coloured beer with an off-white head. The taste is sweet, caramel malty with a strong hopbitter finish. Lots of fruits there. Good beer!

Tap @ 1st BBF De Molen. Dark brown color. Vinous malty, but also wheaty, bready aroma with notes of dried red fruit. Sweet but also wheaty and alcoholic flavor with oily, earthy hops, lingering on in the aftertaste. Notes of red fruit. Yeasty bitter finish. Interesting beer.

Tap @ 1ste Borefts. A clear dark red/brown colored beer, with a thick foamy beige head. The aroma of hop bitter with fruits like cherries. The taste is fruity with malts. There is hop bitter with some notes of sweet. Some alcohol in the back. The aftertaste is dry bitter with some sweet.
